title: Design Twitter (News Feed)
description: Design a simplified version of Twitter where users can post tweets, follow other users, and is able to see the 10 most recent tweets in the user's news feed.

stages.clarification:
Ask about: 
- Daily Active Users (DAU): e.g., 200M 
- Read vs Write ratio: e.g., 100:1 reads to writes?
stages.high_level:
Draw: Client -> Load Balancer -> API Service -> (User DB, Tweet DB). 
Consider Fan-out on Write vs Fan-out on Read services.
stages.deep_dive:
How do you handle 'Celebrity' feeds (Justin Bieber problem)? 
Consider Hybrid Fan-out approach.

title: Design URL Shortener (TinyURL)
description: Design a service like Bit.ly to shorten long URLs and redirect users.
requirements: Given a long URL, return a unique short URL.
Clicking short URL redirects to original.

stages.clarification:
Ask: Traffic volume? 100M URLs/day? 
Length of short URL? (e.g., 7 chars).
stages.high_level:
Draw: Client -> App Server -> Database. 
Discuss: Hash function (MD5? Base62?) vs Key Generation Service (KGS).
stages.deep_dive:
How to handle collisions? 
What if the DB goes down? (Replication/Sharding).

stages.clarification:
Ask: Message storage duration? 
Group chat required? (No for now).
stages.high_level:
Draw: WebSocket Server for real-time. 
HTTP Server for user profile/history.
stages.deep_dive:
How to handle user connection state? (Redis Heartbeat). 
Push notifications for offline users.
